abstract.p: Letter from Hannelore Soderstrom on Gary Kamiya's Jan 23 essay on profound impact Nietzsche had on him (S)

block.p: Gary Kamiya's perceptive, superbly written essay ''Falling Out With Superman'' (Jan. 23), on the profound impact Nietzsche had on him, is in itself a beacon, illuminating aspects of Nietzsche's work that are far too often misconstrued. But more than that, Kamiya has come face to face with Nietzsche's own formula, amor fati: ''that one wants nothing to be different -- not forward, not backward, not in all eternity. Not merely bear what is necessary, still less conceal it . . . but love it'' (from ''Ecce Homo'').
